body: Thanks for the clear bug report! This definitely sounds like a bug, and `has_any_ignore_options` should probably be removed in favor of a predicate that covers all of the cases.

issue.title: Allow custom ignore files to be used exclusively

repository.name: ripgrep
repository.description: ripgrep recursively searches directories for a regex pattern while respecting your gitignore

issue.body:
This change ensures that `add_custom_ignore_filename` works even if all other ignore rules are disabled, see #800.

I'm not whether it is a good idea to adapt the existing unit test (or if I should have added another unit test).

issue.title: Add `--ignore-file` flag

repository.name: fd
repository.description: A simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to 'find'

issue.body:
Basically identical to `rg`'s same flag.

The benefit of this is that sometimes you don't want to ignore every gitignore file found in the search path, but you do want to specifically ignore some files, so this flag comes in handy. Also, if I'm searching from `~`, I don't expect the gitignore file several levels down in some project to get picked up by default.

body: By the way, ripgrep itself is not "affected" (I think) because the custom ignore file (`.rgignore`) is always enabled together with `.ignore`. Therefore, `IgnoreOptions::ignore` will be enabled if `.rgignore` files should be used and `has_any_ignore_options()` returns `true`.
@sharkdp Yup I believe you're right. Thanks for noticing this and filing a bug. :)
